chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Type
Ord: T -> T -> Prop
s: seq T

Goal:
sorted Ord s <-> (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (size s))%nat -> forall x0 : T, Ord (nth x0 s i) (nth x0 s (S i)))

Premises:
Notation seq := list
Module Nat := Struct Definition t : Set. Definition zero : nat. Definition one : nat. Definition two : nat. Definition succ : nat -> nat. Definition pred : nat -> nat. Definition add : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition double : nat -> nat. Definition mul : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition sub : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition eqb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition leb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition ltb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition compare : nat -> nat -> comparison. Definition max : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition min : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition even : nat -> bool. Definition odd : nat -> bool. Definition pow : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_add : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_addmul : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_mul :
pred = fun T : Type => T -> bool : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
sorted = fix sorted (T : Type) (Ord : T -> T -> Prop) (s : seq T) {struct s} : Prop := match s with | [::] => True | [:: h0] => True | h0 :: (h1 :: _) as t0 => Ord h0 h1 /\ sorted T Ord t0 end : forall T : Type, (T -> T -> Prop) -> seq T -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
nth = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) => fix nth (s : seq T) (n : nat) {struct n} : T := match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: s' => match n with | 0%nat => x | S n' => nth s' n' end end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> nat -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope nat_scope]
Module Init := Struct Definition Unconvertible : forall A : Type, A -> A -> Set. Definition unconvertible : forall (A : Type) (a b : A), Unconvertible A a b -> unit. End 
size = fun T : Type => fix size (s : seq T) : nat := match s with | [::] => 0%nat | _ :: s' => S (size s') end : forall T : Type, seq T -> nat Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
all_nthP : forall x0 : ?T, reflect (forall i : nat, ssrnat.leq (S i) (size ?s) -> ?a (nth x0 ?s i)) (all ?a ?s) where ?T : [T : Type Ord : T -> T -> Prop s : seq T |- Type] ?a : [T : Type Ord : T -> T -> Prop s : seq T |- pred ?T] ?s : [T : Type Ord : T -> T -> Prop s : seq T |- seq ?T]
has_nthP : forall x0 : ?T, reflect (exists2 i : nat, ssrnat.leq (S i) (size ?s) & ?a (nth x0 ?s i)) (has ?a ?s) where ?T : [T : Type Ord : T -> T -> Prop s : seq T |- Type] ?a : [T : Type Ord : T -> T -> Prop s : seq T |- pred ?T] ?s : [T : Type Ord : T -> T -> Prop s : seq T |- seq ?T]
nth_uniq : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (x0 : eqtype.Equality.sort T) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)) (i j : nat), ssrnat.leq (S i) (size s) -> ssrnat.leq (S j) (size s) -> uniq s -> eqtype.eq_op (nth x0 s i) (nth x0 s j) = eqtype.eq_op i j
index_uniq : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (x0 : eqtype.Equality.sort T) (i : nat) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)), ssrnat.leq (S i) (size s) -> uniq s -> index (nth x0 s i) s = i
size_belast' : forall s0 : seq ?T, size (belast s0) = Init.Nat.pred (size s0) where ?T : [T : Type Ord : T -> T -> Prop s : seq T |- Type]
take_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> take (S n) s = rcons (take n s) (nth x0 s n)
nthK : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (x0 : eqtype.Equality.sort T) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)), uniq s -> {in ssrnat.gtn (size s), ssrfun.cancel (nth x0 s) (fun x : eqtype.Equality.sort T => index x s)}
nth_zip : forall (S T : Type) (x : S) (y : T) (s : seq S) (t : seq T) (i : nat), size s = size t -> nth (x, y) (zip s t) i = (nth x s i, nth y t i)
last_ind : forall (T : Type) (P : seq T -> Type), P [::] -> (forall (s : seq T) (x : T), P s -> P (rcons s x)) -> forall s : seq T, P s
set_nth_default : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (y0 x0 : T) (n : nat), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> nth x0 s n = nth y0 s n
ordered_Rlist = fun l : Rlist => forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l))%nat -> pos_Rl l i <= pos_Rl l (S i) : Rlist -> Prop
nth_rev : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> nth x0 (rev s) n = nth x0 s (ssrnat.subn (size s) (S n))
adapted_couple_opt = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (l lf : Rlist) => adapted_couple f a b l lf /\ (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength lf))%nat -> pos_Rl lf i <> pos_Rl lf (S i) \/ f (pos_Rl l (S i)) <> pos_Rl lf i) /\ (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l))%nat -> pos_Rl l i <> pos_Rl l (S i)) : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Rlist -> Rlist -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope _ _]
nth_default : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (n : nat), ssrnat.leq (size s) n -> nth x0 s n = x0
drop_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> drop n s = nth x0 s n :: drop (S n) s
mem_nth : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (x0 : eqtype.Equality.sort T) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)) (n : nat), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> nth x0 s n \in s
nth_last : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s (Init.Nat.pred (size s)) = last x0 s
RList_P17 : forall (l1 : Rlist) (x : R) (i : nat), ordered_Rlist l1 -> In x l1 -> pos_Rl l1 i < x -> (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l1))%nat -> pos_Rl l1 (S i) <= x
nth_mkseq : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (f : nat -> T) (n i : nat), ssrnat.leq (S i) n -> nth x0 (mkseq f n) i = f i
head = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: _ => x end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
RList_P6 : forall l : Rlist, ordered_Rlist l < -> (forall i j : nat, (i <= j)%nat -> (j < Rlength l)%nat -> pos_Rl l i <= pos_Rl l j)
nth0 : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s 0 = head x0 s
nth_map : forall (T1 : Type) (x1 : T1) (T2 : Type) (x2 : T2) (f : T1 -> T2) (n : nat) (s : seq T1), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> nth x2 [seq f i | i <- s] n = f (nth x1 s n)
nth_pairmap : forall (T1 : Type) (x1 : T1) (T2 : Type) (x2 : T2) (f : T1 -> T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1) (n : nat), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> forall x : T1, nth x2 (pairmap f x s) n = f (nth x1 (x :: s) n) (nth x1 s n)
nth_rcons : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (x : T) (n : nat), nth x0 (rcons s x) n = (if ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) then nth x0 s n else if eqtype.eq_op n (size s) then x else x0)
RList_P13 : forall (l : Rlist) (i : nat) (a : R), (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l))%nat -> pos_Rl (mid_Rlist l a) (S i) = (pos_Rl l i + pos_Rl l (S i)) / 2
nth_behead : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (n : nat), nth x0 (behead s) n = nth x0 s (S n)
StepFun_P38 : forall (l : Rlist) (a b : R) (f : R -> R), ordered_Rlist l -> pos_Rl l 0 = a -> pos_Rl l (Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l)) = b -> {g : StepFun a b | g b = f b /\ (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l))%nat -> constant_D_eq g (co_interval (pos_Rl l i) (pos_Rl l (S i))) (f (pos_Rl l i)))}
last_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 x : T) (s : seq T), last x s = nth x0 (x :: s) (size s)
SubEqui_P9 : forall (a b : R) (del : posreal) (f : R -> R) (h : a < b), {g : StepFun a b | g b = f b /\ (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength (SubEqui del h)))%nat -> constant_D_eq g (co_interval (pos_Rl (SubEqui del h) i) (pos_Rl (SubEqui del h) (S i))) (f (pos_Rl (SubEqui del h) i)))}
